title: May Margaret,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: On the strand of the Pool of Thrieve, vainly cursing, imprecating, foaming at the mouth with baffled fury, Malise the Smith stood watching James Douglas — the man for whom so many had flung away their lives, ride comfortably into the deep, green solitudes of the Balmaghie  woods.

title: May Margaret,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: Some mounted on the fallen tower and began shooting arrows into the Pool of Dee.

title: May Margaret,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: Once entered there, not only would the whole castle lie void of defence, but from the water gate and the balcony the King's men could shoot at their ease the swimmers across the Pool of Thrieve.

title: May Margaret,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: The same white charger which had brought him so gloriously home from Arkinholm was already gingerly pacing down the steps which led to the great western Pool of Thrieve — one of the deepest in the whole course of the Dee.

title: May Margaret,
author: Crockett, S. R.
snippet: Trust me — I will keep your rear-guard until such time as I see you set spurs in your beast on the other side of the Pool of Thrieve."
